unnormalised: Planning a shaadi in Mumbai? Or maybe a corporate event that needs that special touch? Finding the perfect venue can feel like climbing Mount Everest, right? But don’t worry, I’ve got you covered with some pointers and unnormalized data that should make your venue hunt a bit easier.
normalised: Planning a shaadi in Mumbai? Or maybe a corporate event that needs that special touch? Finding the perfect venue can feel like climbing Mount Everest, right? But do not worry, I have got you covered with some pointers and unnormalized data that should make your venue hunt a bit easier.

unnormalised: First things first, location, location, location! Think about your guests. If most are coming from the suburbs, a venue in South Bombay might not be ideal. Areas like Bandra West, with addresses such as 14th Road, Bandra, Maharashtra, 400050, or Andheri East, near the airport, are usually good central locations. Keep in mind the rush hour traffic too! Try to avoid venues right on the Western Express Highway if you're planning an evening event.
normalised: First things first, location, location, location! Think about your guests. If most are coming from the suburbs, a venue in South Bombay might not be ideal. Areas like Bandra West, with addresses such as fourteenth Road, Bandra, Maharashtra, four hundred thousand and fifty, or Andheri East, near the airport, are usually good central locations. Keep in mind the rush hour traffic too! Try to avoid venues right on the Western Express Highway if you are planning an evening event.

unnormalised: Then comes the size. Don't book a massive ballroom for a small get-together! It will feel empty and awkward. Conversely, cramming 200 people into a space meant for 100 is a recipe for disaster. Most venues will list their capacity. Look for something like “Hall A – Capacity: 150-200 pax”. Always round down, just to be safe!
normalised: Then comes the size. Do not book a massive ballroom for a small get-together! It will feel empty and awkward. Conversely, cramming two hundred people into a space meant for one hundred is a recipe for disaster. Most venues will list their capacity. Look for something like “Hall A – Capacity: one hundred and fifty to two hundred pax”. Always round down, just to be safe!

unnormalised: Budget is obviously a huge factor. Many venues operate on a per-plate basis, meaning you pay a fixed amount per guest for food and drinks. Some might have minimum guarantee requirements, like “Minimum Guarantee: 100 pax”. Be sure to clarify all costs upfront, including service charges and taxes. You don’t want any nasty surprises! Venues such as the Grand Hyatt, located at Santacruz (E), Mumbai, 400054, might have a higher price point per plate of Rs. 3500++.

unnormalised: Now, let’s talk about ambience. Do you want something modern and minimalist? Or are you looking for traditional elegance? There are so many different styles to choose from! Many wedding venues, especially those in areas like Juhu, 400049, offer customizable décor packages. Consider venues like the Taj Lands End, Bandstand, Bandra West, Mumbai, 400050.

unnormalised: Don't forget the small details! Does the venue have sufficient parking space? Are there good restroom facilities? What about accessibility for elderly or disabled guests? These seemingly minor things can make a big difference to the overall experience. And most importantly, check reviews! Read what other people have said about the venue. Sites like WeddingWire and Zomato are your friends here!

unnormalised: Also, consider amenities. A/C, sound system, power backup... these are all essential! You don't want the music to cut out in the middle of the sangeet because of a power failure. Ask about their generator capacity and ensure it's adequate for your event.

unnormalised: Finally, always, always visit the venue in person before booking! Pictures can be deceiving. See the space for yourself, meet the event managers, and get a feel for the place. Trust your gut! Happy venue hunting!
